choices.name: Get started with research for your Maryland ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Maryland ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine oppourtnities for Maryland research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Maryland research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Maryland Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Ancestry: Explore resources for Maryland research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Maryland Resources

  3. Get an overview of Maryland research in these videos.

    ☆ FS—Maryland Overview—2:05
    ☆ FS—Beginning Maryland Research—65:32



  4. Follow this research study for Maryland ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Maryland Research, 1880-Present

  5. Study the Ancestry State Guide for Maryland research.

    ☆ AC—Maryland State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  6. Record Finder: Use the Maryland Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Maryland Record Finder

    7. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial Maryland.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Maryland

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Maryland in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Maryland
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Maryland Minorities

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Maryland African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Maryland.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Maryland in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Maryland


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about research in colonial Maryland.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Maryland
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Maryland in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Maryland
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maryland Minorities

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—Maryland African American Records

  3. Explore the African American Gateway for Maryland.
  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Maryland in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Maryland

1. Explore Maryland historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—California History

  2. Explore Maryland history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Maryland

  3. Learn about Maryland history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Maryland History

choices.name: Learn about Maryland archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Maryland archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maryland Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Maryland State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
    ☆ Maryland State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Maryland.
  3. Explore the Maryland Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore the Digital Maryland site.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Maryland genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Maryland research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Maryland ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Maryland city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maryland Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Maryland city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Maryland city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Maryland ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Maryland city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Maryland County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Maryland.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Maryland Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Maryland Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Maryland Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Maryland Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. South Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Maryland.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Maryland research.
  2. Explore the Maryland research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Explore the ☆FamilySearch community for help with Maryland research.
  4. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Maryland research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Maryland in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Maryland Societies

  2. Explore the Maryland Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Maryland Historical Society site.
  4. Explore Maryland genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Maryland.
